text:
Simon pushed himself to his limits on Wednesday night's episode of The Biggest Loser: Transformed.
The 34-year-old, who weighs in at 108kg, was taking part in the Benchmark Challenge when it all became too much.
After completing a gruelling set of burpees, the marketing manager was seen on all fours as he vomited into a drain.

A determined Simon explained he wasn't going to give up, despite the fact that personal trainer Libby Babet 'absolutely caned me'.
'That was definitely not my finest hour. That was a great session to prove how much work I need,' he reflected.
While Simon appreciates the training from Libby and Shannan Ponton, fans on social media weren't convinced that seeing the married father of two throwing up was a good sign.

One commented: 'Exercising until you vomit isn't what it 'takes to be transformed'. A healthy diet and regular, normal exercise is.'
Simon's spew followed further physical drama on the revamped show.
Lynton was left temporarily paralysed after waking up with shooting pains in his arms and was unable to lift himself from bed.
The 27-year-old blamed a 3.5km kayak across Sydney Harbour in the opening challenge of the series, which was shown on the programme's debut on Tuesday.

He said: 'I haven't done anything this active before, never been to a gym. And I've just kayaked across Sydney Harbour!'
The 11th season of the weight loss show has received a low-key reception, with viewers' disdain at the new format reflected in the ratings.
Tuesday night premiere failed to make the top ten most-watched programs of the day, placing 17th and only narrowly beating a repeat of NCIS.
A measly 450,000 viewers tuned in to watch the show as fans took to social media to slam the show for being too much like cooking shows My Kitchen Rules and MasterChef.
